Flexible Probabilities Driven Bootstrap

Source: R/bootstrap_scenarios.R
bootstrap_scenarios.Rd

This function resamples scenarios given by the flexible probabilities approach.

bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

# S3 method for numeric
bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

# S3 method for matrix
bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

# S3 method for ts
bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

# S3 method for xts
bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

# S3 method for tbl
bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

# S3 method for data.frame
bootstrap_scenarios(x, p, n)

Arguments

x

A time-series defining the scenario-probability distribution.
p

A vector of probabilities.
n

An integer scalar with the number of scenarios to be generated.

Value

The argument `x` is supposed to have the same size of `p`.

Examples

set.seed(123)
ret <- diff(log(EuStockMarkets))
ew  <- rep(1 / nrow(ret), nrow(ret))

bootstrap_scenarios(x = ret, p = ew, n = 10)

#>                DAX           SMI          CAC          FTSE
